metadata.Description: Energy generated from the wind through the use of wind turbines to produce electricity.

level 1.Description: Wind energy implements Energy Efficiency Policy by promoting the use of energy-saving designs and materials.
Wind energy funds Research and Development to improve wind turbine efficiency and develop new technologies.
Wind energy focuses on Renewable Energy Sources as a sustainable and clean energy solution.
Wind energy is used in Wind Farms to generate electricity from wind power.
Wind energy partners with Grid Operators to ensure efficient integration of wind power into the electricity grid.
Wind energy contributes to Climate Change Mitigation by reducing greenhouse gas emissions.
Wind energy monitors the performance of wind turbines to ensure optimal efficiency.
Wind energy targets Offshore Wind Development to harness the potential of wind resources in coastal areas.

level 2.Subject: energy efficiency
level 2.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

level 2.Subject: energy efficiency
level 2.Description: Energy efficiency employs energy audits to identify energy-saving opportunities and optimize energy use.

level 2.Subject: renewable energy agencies
level 2.Description: Renewable energy agencies employ experts in the field of renewable energy to drive innovation and promote the adoption of clean energy technologies.

level 2.Subject: renewable energy agencies
level 2.Description: Renewable energy agencies collaborate with research institutions to advance scientific knowledge and develop new technologies for renewable energy generation.

level 3.Subject: energy storage
level 3.Description: Energy storage addresses the issue of intermittency in renewable energy sources by storing excess energy for use during periods of low generation.

level 3.Subject: energy markets
level 3.Description: Energy markets address the issue of energy access by ensuring the availability and affordability of energy sources for all segments of society.

level 3.Subject: renewable energy certificates
level 3.Description: Renewable energy certificates are implemented by the Energy Efficiency Policy to promote the use of renewable energy sources.

level 3.Subject: energy efficiency
level 3.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

subelement_relations.Description: Wind turbines are devices that convert the kinetic energy of the wind into mechanical energy, which can then be used to generate electricity. They are a key component of wind energy systems.
Wind farms are large areas of land or water where multiple wind turbines are installed to generate electricity on a larger scale. They are an important infrastructure for harnessing wind energy.
Wind power refers to the conversion of wind energy into a useful form, such as electricity or mechanical power. It is a sustainable and renewable source of energy.

Wind resources refer to the availability and potential of wind energy in a particular area. Factors such as wind speed, direction, and consistency determine the suitability of a location for wind energy projects.
Wind speed is a crucial parameter for wind energy generation. Higher wind speeds result in greater power output from wind turbines. It is measured using anemometers.
